content: MAGIX Movie Studio (formerly Movie Edit Pro) is a video editor designed primarily for editing and sharing home movies, while Video Pro X is geared for professional editors. When you import video clips into the software, it organizes them as movies.

In the software, you can export the movies as MVD files, which is helpful for transferring one or more video clips between MVP projects. To export one or more video clips as MVD movies, open the "Movie Managing Menu, then select Export movie.

description: An MVD file is a movie created with MAGIX Movie Studio and Video Pro X, movie editing applications. It contains references to video and audio files, movie edit points, and detected scenes (and may also include a variety of custom effects). Movie Studio and Video Pro X users often import MVD files into .MVP projects, then export them to common video formats, upload them online, or burn them to a DVD or Blu-ray disc.

instructions: You can open MVD files with MAGIX Movie Studio and Video Pro X in Windows. To open an MVD file, select File → Open or open the "Movie Managing Menu, then select Import movie.
